Simplified install

Kodak Alaris | Lead Design | 2015

Kodak Alaris makes high speed scanning systems for data processing. I needed to simplify the install process.

Documenting the Current State

One of the first things I did at Kodak Alaris was to get myself an unopened scanner in a box and document the installation process. The onboarding process involved clicking thru 57 screens of info regarding addresses, phone, number of employees, revenue, and more.

I started to ask what the information was needed for. I was directed to marketing.

  • Marketing told me they don't use the info. Ask Sales.
  • Sales told me they don't use it. Ask Support.
  • Support assured me they get all their info on each phone call.

After I was able to demonstrate that the information was being collected and stored for nobody, I was able to convince the team we don't need it.

Benchmarking

Next I started looking for the best in class installation processes. There were a few that stood out.

Bose Speakers

Bose wireless speaker systems use an app to find new devices, then easily add them to your network in about 6 steps.

Google Chromecast

Google Chromecast uses the TV screen to direct users to download an app (or visit an URL) needed to complete setup in a few simple steps.

The Design Work

With CDs becoming less common, and some government customers without internet access, I proposed we include a stable version of the software install on the device. We can connect to the device and download the software.

We had different versions of the workflow depending on the type of connection: wired or wireless networking, direct-connect.

  • The display panel on the scanner instructs the user to a website
  • Using a trick I learned from benchmarking, we can create a local 'ad-hoc' network via wire or wifi from the device.
  • If the user has internet access, we can get the latest version of the software. Otherwise we use the version shipped.
  • After software is installed, we automatically connect to nearby scanners, ready to work.

A version for Ethernet connected PC and Ethernet scanner

Another version for wireless scanner and wireless PC

Results

Part of the usability testing involved the out-of-box setup. We conducted A/B testing of the CD install vs the 'bootstrapped' install. Eight people, chosen for experience in related industry role, participated in the study.

The completion time was vastly shorter and participants overwhelmingly preferred the new version.
